summary:
I am an experienced audit, control, planning and accounting professional with a solid track record in leading organisations in a global environment. 

I am internationally driven and used to deal with senior management. I like to act as a business partner, I can work under pressure and my motivation barely has a limit as soon as I embrace a project or an objective.

Key competences:
External and internal audit
Accounting and reporting
Business control
Budget and forecast
Strategic planning
Internal control
Risk management
Capital expenditure
Project management
Process improvement
English and French

profile_positions.description:
Konecranes Software Solutions is group of companies employing 300 persons in 5 entities across 4 countries and specialised in the design and delivery of software dedicated to the automation of container terminals on a global scale. 

Key responsibilities:
•	Member of the Management team
•	Reporting, management of the finance team, coordination of month-end closing, US GAAP & IFRS 
•	Internal control and compliance, SOx, process reorganisation, management of internal & external audits
•	Business control, preparation of budget and forecasts, monthly analysis, quarterly reporting
•	Cash management, reduction of working capital and accounts receivable
•	Responsible for 5 reporting entities in 3 countries
•	ERP (SAP) implementation
profile_positions.title: Head of Finance

profile_positions.description:
The Curacao Tourism Board promotes and develops tourism on the Dutch Caribbean island since 1915. The European Branch manages a budget of approximately €5 million per year.

Key responsibilities:
•	Internal control: process reorganization, improvement and simplification of procedures enabling safer operations, liaising with internal audit function, recommendations made to management and head office
•	Planning: preparation and validation with management of budget and rolling forecast
•	Accounting: execution of AR, AP, payroll and closing activities, payment processing, preparation of entries
•	Cash: management of working capital, funding requests, alignment with head office, resource reallocation
profile_positions.title: Finance Manager

profile_positions.description:
VIN is a non-governmental, not-for-profit organisation whose mission is to empower marginalised communities, with a focus on women and children, through enhanced educational programs and community training to promote equality, economic well being and basic human rights.

Key responsibilities:
•	Working for VIN on a voluntary basis
•	Finalization of the Annual Report
•	Analysis and improvement of accounting & administrative processes
•	Redesign of micro-saving/credit procedures
•	Issuance of recommendations to management
profile_positions.title: Volunteer

profile_positions.description:
Huawei is a high-tech Chinese company specialized in the design, manufacturing and maintenance of internet and telecom network as well as the design and manufacturing of smartphones et tablets. Huawei employs 150.000 persons for a revenue of $35 milliards in 2012.

Key responsibilities:
•	Hired by the holding company incorporated in Amsterdam, controlling all overseas subsidiaries of Huawei, which represent 2/3 of the revenue of the company
•	Preparation of the handover to the holding company of numerous process managed so far solely by the headquarter in Shenzen, China: merger & acquisitions, inception of new subsidiaries, loans to subsidiaries, guarantees, dividends, management of subsidiaries
•	Project management with the executive team; creation, improvement and implementation of procedures; organisation and preparation of management board meetings
profile_positions.title: Financial Advisor to the Board of Directors

profile_positions.description: Investing in Lovefood HQ was a personal initiative linked to my passion for food. Main activities consisted of finalizing the business plan, setting up the location, recruiting key personnel, monitoring actuals, etc.
profile_positions.title: Co-founder and shareholder

profile_positions.description:
TNT Express serves more than 200 countries and has delivered 4.4 million documents per weeks leading to revenues of €7.3 billion in 2012. TNT Express is listed on the Amsterdam Stock Exchange.

Key responsibilities:
•	Quarterly and full year results: preparation of press releases and analysts’ presentations
•	Relationship with capital markets: follow up on issues and questions with investors and analysts
•	Capital Markets Day: preparation of the storyline and the material with the Director of Investor Relations 
•	Ad-hoc reporting to CFO and Board of Management: movement in share price, reactions of capital markets, competitors’ results
profile_positions.title: Manager Investor Relations

profile_positions.description:
Member of a team of 3 reporting to the CFO of TNT Group, performing thorough analyses leading to an independent perspective on budget, periodic results, Capex and generating output increasing business understanding and enabling the Board of Management of heads of divisions to make sound decisions. 

Key responsibilities:
• Monthly business reviews
• Budget
• Strategic plan
• Capital Expenditures
• Ad hoc-projects (M&A, valuation, investor relations, business plans, etc.)
profile_positions.title: Manager Business Control

profile_positions.description:
Project management and implementation of the SOx project at TNT Group Head Office with SOx certification obtained by TNT in February 2007
Key responsibilities:
• Coordination and monitoring of SOx, ISO and internal control tasks at TNT Group Head Office 
• Identifications of risks to the Financial Statements, design of Internal Control Framework of Group Head Office
• Management of relationship with external auditors and external resources
profile_positions.title: Internal Control Manager

profile_positions.description:
Assessment of quality and monitoring of compliance by management with business objectives, financial and management reporting, policies and procedures, fraud prevention, risk management and internal controls
Key responsibilities:
• Planning, completion and management of audits
• Coverage of all key business cycles:  Financial Reporting, Sales, Purchasing, Payroll, HR, IT, Operations.
• All divisions of TNT Group covered
• Extensive travel (85%) on a global scale
profile_positions.title: Senior International Auditor

profile_positions.description:
Planning and execution of financial audits for a large variety organisations within assigned deadlines and budgets, preparation of statutory accounts and supervision of junior staff
Key responsibilities:
• Management of relationship with the client on-site 
• Training of newcomers to KPMG audit methodology
• Significant clients: RTL Group, European Coal and Steel Community, Arcelor Group, European Investment Fund and TDK Europe SA.
profile_positions.title: Senior Auditor
